image.altText: a close up of a woman charging an EV

props.synopsis: The NSW government announces more than 650 additional EV charging ports will be provided across 16 local government areas over the next 12 months.

title.children: NSW government announces plan to roll out hundreds of public EV charging ports

image.altText: sunset over Fannie Bay Sunset in Darwin NT

props.synopsis: A north-west cloud band will engulf Australia this week, signalling a rapid transition away from the monotonous high pressure systems which have dominated recent weather charts.

title.children: First cloud band of year to bring rain to most of Australia — just in time for parched regions

image.altText: nsw police search banks of cooks river after sign of birth found

props.synopsis: NSW Police holds serious concerns for the wellbeing of a newborn baby and its mother after a passer-by found "signs of birth" on the banks of the Cooks River in Earlwood.

title.children: Search underway for mother and baby after 'placenta and umbilical cord' found on banks of river in Sydney

image.altText: An image of fire and ashes. Next to it Palestinians searching through the ashes with their hands.

props.synopsis: Israel's leader told parliament the strike was not intended to kill civilians and will be investigated.

title.children: Israeli PM admits something 'went tragically wrong' in strike that killed dozens of Palestinians in Rafah

image.altText: A family photo featuring mum, dad, and five kids, posing in front of a scenic rainforest and body of water.

props.synopsis: Queensland's Daintree Rainforest does not have mains electricity — so many residents are burning hundreds of litres of "dirty" diesel fuel a week just to keep their businesses running.

title.children: Pristine nature, dirty power: The diesel vs solar debate raging inside the world's oldest rainforest

image.altText: Unidentified woman looks away while holding medical records.

props.synopsis: The federal government has been heavily criticised by the domestic, sexual and family violence response sector following its budget. Today its "rapid review" of how to best prevent violence against women will begin in Sydney.

title.children: Expert panel to tell government how to prevent violence against women and children

image.altText: A couple looks at each other and smiles

props.synopsis: In a city that is less affordable than Sydney, London and New York to purchase a home, some young Taiwanese people are trying desperately to buy, while others are giving up on the real estate dream altogether.

title.children: In expensive Taiwan, some young people are giving up on real estate to join the 'moonlight clan' instead

image.altText: Birds fly out the front of Parliament House

props.synopsis: Prime Minister Anthony Albanese is facing a call to reverse an "interim" law he introduced more than a decade ago to make a Parliament House department exempt from Freedom of Information requests.

title.children: Parliament House department shrouded in secrecy facing calls for greater transparency

image.altText: A young woman with dark hair and a black dress stands in a softly lit Melbourne apartment.

props.synopsis: A building company used to construct affordable housing under a government program has been linked to a notorious residential construction company that collapsed last year amid legal battles.

title.children: Elise thought she had finally found secure housing. Now she's worried her lease is a 'trap'

image.altText: A woman wearing sunglasses stares into the distance.

props.synopsis: Kallista Mutten has given evidence in the trial of Justin Stein, who is accused of murdering her daughter Charlise in 2022, in the NSW Supreme Court. Mr Stein has pleaded not guilty to the charge.

title.children: Charlise Mutten's mother says accused killer told her he may need to 'get rid of some evidence', court hears

image.altText: Image shows congestion and traffic delays. You can see cars, grey road on a gloomy day.

props.synopsis: Nationally, most of us opt to get behind the wheel when it comes to commuting to work. But as one Australian state slashes public transport fares, experts say there's more to do in improving the way we get around.

title.children: As Queensland trials 50c public transport fares, experts say there are more ways to improve our commute

image.altText: A smiling brown-haired woman puts a 'sold' sticker on a 'for auction' sign outside a house.

props.synopsis: A surge in home loan hardship requests and a record number of quick resales are two signs that Australia is still perilously close to the edge of the mortgage cliff.

title.children: The mortgage cliff warning signs are plain to see for those who bother to look

image.altText: Two men wearing white jackets and protective glasses look up at a vessel holding red liquid.

props.synopsis: Australian researchers are working on developing drugs that target bugs in the guts of Parkinson's disease patients in a radical new treatment approach they hope will slow or even stop the progression of the debilitating illness.

title.children: 'Bugs as drugs': Researchers target the gut in hope to stop progression of Parkinson's disease

image.altText: A graphic of a piggy bank with smoking chimneys with dollar notes in the background

props.synopsis: Australia's largest superannuation funds have doubled their investments in high-emitting companies over the past two years, according to environmental finance group Market Forces.

title.children: Just how green is your super fund? Chances are your savings are being used to fund major fossil fuel projects

image.altText: A plastic container with roast chicken and pork and rice.

props.synopsis: Taiwan's customs officials issue a fine of NT$200,000 ($9,369) to a traveller for attempting to bring a lunch box containing pork into the country.

title.children: Visitor to Taiwan hit with $9,000 fine over 'roast chicken and pork combo' lunch box

image.altText: A designed artist's graphic of a man and a kit home.

props.synopsis: These tiny homes were sold to Australians as part of a solution to the nation's housing crisis. The company involved took the money for them but never delivered.

title.children: 'Want my money back': Australians caught in tiny homes 'rip-off' demand action

image.altText: The outside of the Nine Entertainment headquarters in North Sydney.

props.synopsis: Mike Sneesby, chief executive of media company Nine, acknowledges "serious" claims of "alleged inappropriate behaviour" at the network.

title.children: Internal email to Nine staff raises 'alleged inappropriate behaviour'

image.altText: Adam Bray, right, and Zach Bray who died in the hunter bus crash of June 11, 2023

props.synopsis: Adam Bray's son, Zach, was among the 10 victims of last year's crash. He was one of the family members who met with the NSW Attorney-General Michael Daley this morning.

title.children: 'We are devastated': Manslaughter charges for Hunter bus crash driver will not be reinstated

image.altText: Open for lease sign on footpath outside a property in Canberra.

props.synopsis: Rental prices in Bunbury and the Sunshine Coast went up by more than 4 per cent in the past three months, with three quarters of Australia's biggest regional areas with higher rents than ever.

title.children: Rents hit record high across Australia's biggest regions with WA and Queensland topping the list

image.altText: courthouse

props.synopsis: A court has been told former Newcastle Knights star Robbie O'Davis will appeal a conviction for assault.

title.children: Former Kangaroo and Newcastle Knights star Robbie O'Davis to appeal assault conviction

image.altText: Troops in uniform walk away from the camera holding riot shields in the street

props.synopsis: A state of emergency declared in New Caledonia following riots that have left seven people and hundreds arrested is expected to end on Tuesday morning.

title.children: French government to lift New Caledonia's state of emergency in bid to ease tensions on riot-hit island

image.altText: A composite image of an older man and an older woman smiling.

props.synopsis: A Victorian Supreme Court jury has heard the remains of slain campers Russell Hill and Carol Clay were so damaged by fire that an expert could not determine how they died.

title.children: 'Evidence has been obliterated': Pathologist unable to determine cause of campers Russell Hill and Carol Clay's death

image.altText: Composite image between Bruce Lehrmann and Lisa Wilkinson.

props.synopsis: Lawyers in a battle over costs in the failed defamation action by former Liberal staffer Bruce Lehrmann are given a month to arrive at a dollar figure.

title.children: Lisa Wilkinson seeking $1.8m over Bruce Lehrmann's failed defamation case, Federal Court hears

image.altText: A train platform.

props.synopsis: The NSW government has announced the completion of Sydney Metro's first new City and Southwest line station in Waterloo. The development includes new private and social housing to be added to the Waterloo Metro Quarter.

title.children: Sydney Metro's first new train station on City and Southwest line unveiled

image.altText: Emergency service workers work to pry open a smashed-up car involved in a multi vehicle crash at night.

props.synopsis: A fatal collision involving a rideshare car on Sunday night has resulted in the deaths of a father and his daughter, while his nine-year-old son and the driver of the car are in hospital in a stable condition.

title.children: Father and 11yo daughter killed in rideshare collision in Sydney's south-west

image.altText: Parliament House shrouded in fog.

props.synopsis: It's the government department tasked with protecting Australia's democracy, yet within it bubble accusations of a toxic culture, the silencing of dissent and the routine cover-up of problems.

title.children: It's tasked with protecting Australia's democracy. But inside bubble accusations of a toxic culture

image.altText: A man in his 50s, with a close-cropped grey beard, walking on a street.

props.synopsis: The former music director at a prestigious north Queensland school lost his job and house but has avoided jail over "depraved" messages.

title.children: Former teacher's deep shame after describing sexual fantasies of young boys on adult chat line

image.altText: picture and flowers

props.synopsis: Robert William Brown, 75, died after he was pushed over during a robbery in Toowoomba early last year. A 19-year-old will serve at least three-and-half years in jail after pleading guilty to manslaughter.

title.children: Teenager jailed for manslaughter over robbery death of elderly man at Queensland taxi rank

image.altText: Rowland points her finger at a white female security guard, talking strnly to her while the guard has her arm around her back.

props.synopsis: Kelly Rowland accuses Cannes security of racial profiling, Lizzo addresses South Park parody and more entertainment news you might have missed.

title.children: 'I have a boundary': Kelly Rowland makes first statement after being moved along at Cannes

image.altText: A mother and daughter named Jennifer and Gretl Petelczyc smiling happily in a photo.

props.synopsis: The murder of two Perth women in their own home has shocked WA and turned political attention to whether the state's proposed new gun laws are tough enough.

title.children: 'Abhorrent, gutless act': Perth murder-suicide labelled act of domestic violence

image.altText: The entry to Mount Scopus Memorial College, a rendered white fence with an Australian and Jewish flag

props.synopsis: Mount Scopus Memorial College was the target of an anti-Semitic graffiti attack that MPs have labelled an 'appalling act'.

title.children: 'It has no place in Australia': An anti-Semitic attack on a Victorian school condemned by politicians

image.altText: A person getting off a bus in Brisbane.

props.synopsis: Queenslanders will pay 50 cents for each trip on a train, bus and ferry from August 5 for any distance and in any direction.

title.children: Donna spends $90 travelling to Brisbane for work every week. A new trial will see that slashed to $5

image.altText: An illustration of an electric car and a petrol car.

props.synopsis: Whether you drive an electric car or are considering making the switch, you've probably been drawn into a discussion about whether they are really better for the climate. To save you from your next barbecue encounter, we have put two cars to the test.

title.children: Are electric cars really greener than petrol cars? We've lined up two SUVs and put them to the test
